title: Congratulationg Christopher Datsikas upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Voice of Democracy Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  Christopher  Datsikas  upon the
occasion of his designation as recipient of the Voice of Democracy Award
by the Veterans of Foreign Wars of The United States  William  M.  Gouse
Jr. Post 3211

WHEREAS,  It is the custom of this Legislative Body to recognize and pay
tribute to those exemplary students who  have  distinguished  themselves
through  their  outstanding  commitment,  and  who have received notable
recognition within their academic community; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to congratu-
late Christopher Datsikas upon the occasion of his designation as recip-
ient of the Voice of Democracy Award by the  Veterans  of  Foreign  Wars
(VFW)  of  The United States William M. Gouse Jr. Post 3211, to be cele-
brated at its annual Voice of Democracy  and  Patriot's  Pen  Awards  in
Hicksville, New York, on Monday, February 28, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  The National Association of Broadcasters began sponsoring an
annual speech competition in 1946 for high school  students  called  the
Voice  of Democracy; since 1960, the VFW has assumed sole sponsorship of
the competition; and
  WHEREAS, The Voice of Democracy competition is  open  to  high  school
sophomores,  juniors, and seniors across the country; each contestant is
required to write and record a  three  to  five  minute  script  on  the
subject selected as that year's topic; and
  WHEREAS,  Christopher  Datsikas proudly claimed third place for Hicks-
ville High School's Voice of Democracy Essay and Tape Contest; and
  WHEREAS, Educational competitions which serve to  better  prepare  our
students  for  their  future  participation  in  patriotic  and academic
endeavors are worthy of praise and support; and
  WHEREAS, Poised eagerly with enthusiasm and determined purpose, Chris-
topher Datsikas now stands honorably, with just pride in his accomplish-
ments and in eager anticipation of future challenges, understanding  and
appreciating  the  caring  counsel and support provided by his teachers,
coaches and parents; and
  WHEREAS, It is the intent of this Legislative Body to commend and  pay
tribute  to  those young people who, by achieving outstanding success in
educational competition, have inspired and brought pride to our majestic
Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
congratulate  Christopher  Datsikas upon the occasion of his designation
as recipient of the Voice of Democracy Award by the Veterans of  Foreign
Wars  of  The  United  States  William M. Gouse Jr. Post 3211; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Hicksville High School, Hicksville, New York, and Christopher
Datsikas.
